items.sentence: Tom was the one who told me I shouldn't do that.
What is apathy? Certainly nothing earth-shaking.
Tom had Christmas lights strung up on his porch.
I've heard that Tom is a good volleyball player.
Did you find out why Tom didn't want to do that?
Tom doesn't have the qualities of a good leader.
You plan to go out dancing with Mary, don't you?
Tom opened the blinds and looked out the window.
The man at the front desk gave Tom his room key.
I'm not the only one who doesn't agree with Tom.
We're about three blocks from the train station.
Tom looked surprised at how well Mary was doing.
Tom and I haven't seen each other since college.
I have almost three thousand dollars in my safe.
Tom pointed at the restaurant across the street.
Tom picked up the water bottle and took a drink.
It's about three miles from here to the station.
All three of you chop wood every day, don't you?
Tom snapped his fingers and pointed to the door.
Tom's body seems to be accepting the transplant.
Every time I see Tom, he's talking on his phone.
Tom asked me to return the money I had borrowed.
Tom canceled his appointment at the last moment.
Tom is one of the wealthiest men in the country.
Tom leaned in and gave Mary a kiss on the cheek.
Tom marked a sentence with a yellow highlighter.
Can Tom really be as rich as people think he is?
I first met Tom in a little bar outside of town.
You should just do what Tom is asking you to do.
Let's see if Tom can manage to do it by himself.
Let's not discuss this in front of Tom and Mary.
I haven't seen one of those in over three years.
You don't think Tom might still be here, do you?
Tom took care of my dog while I was out of town.
Tom has to do it even though he doesn't want to.
Tom kicked the door open and went into the room.
Tom Jackson didn't report for duty this morning.
Tom was nice enough to carry my suitcase for me.
Tom is going to be in Boston all week, isn't he?
I'm pretty sure this has nothing to do with Tom.
You don't have to tell Tom if you don't want to.
You can tell Tom really doesn't want to be here.
Why would Tom tell Mary you were his girlfriend?
Tom told me where I could buy the part I needed.
Tom told me I didn't need to worry about paying.
Tom told Mary he thought it was time to go home.
Tom and Mary just did what they were told to do.
Tell Tom we're going to meet him at the airport.
Tell Tom to meet me in front of the post office.
Please tell Tom I'll pick him up at the station.
